title: Still getting prompted to sign into gmail
content: Hi! I think I've removed every tie to an old gmail account on thunderbird, and yet it still prompts me to sign in every time I open it - please help! What can I do to stop this?
creator: smartshoe

title: Help me find import export tools
content: Tools > ImportExportTools NG > Import MBOX file, select the 2GB MBOX file [web:4].
creator: Rachel.a.bowman10

title: I can not send out emails from Thunderbird.
content: I can not send out emails from Thunderbird. I get the following message "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.xxxx.ca timed out. Try again." I have not been able to find an answer to this problem. I hope you can help. Please note I am a Senior so please be patient with me. Thanks, Al
creator: retired_cga

title: Importing emails contained in a DAT file
content:
I am trying to transition from Microsoft Outlook to Thunderbird. An essential part of the puzzle that needs to be solved is how to migrate the many emails from Outlook into Thunderbird.

In Outlook, I can select several emails and forward them to myself, but they are bundled in a file with extension DAT. Outlook has no trouble understanding the contents of the DAT file, but Thunderbird only sees a file it doesn't know what to do with.

Is there perhaps an addon for Thunderbird that can parse the DAT file contents into individual messages?
creator: tpgettys

title: How can I change the email message thread settings?
content:
Here's the big problem. At some point suddenly all of the email message thread with a person start lining up in one email. If it's all lined up chronologically, then I can get through to whatever the part or date I want to read again, however, for whatever the crazy reasons, in some parts, it's not chronological and older dates are all mixed up, and it's giving me hell!!! I asked how I can make it all separate, my friend told me to do:

to me try this, i found this as solution, but dont know how it will look after you vhange, Maybe to try other gmail application?

Turn off Conversation View:
